responses: With PCMB you can keep options open for both Engineering and Medical careers. Consider interdisciplinary UG courses like Biomedical Engineering or choose at Class 12 based on entrance tests.
UG options in science include: B.Tech/B.E (Engineering), MBBS/BDS (Medical), B.Sc (Pure Sciences), B.Arch (Architecture), B.Pharm, B.Sc Nursing, B.Sc Agriculture, and more.
PG options include M.Tech, M.Sc, MD/MS, MDS, MBA (Tech Management), M.Phil, and PhD for research-focused careers.
Common entrance exams: JEE Main/Advanced for engineering, NEET for medicine, state-level CETs, and specialized exams for architecture (NATA) and agriculture (ICAR AIEEA).
Try a short aptitude test to understand strengths (maths/logic vs memory/rote). If unsure, take PCMB to keep options open or do a psychometric test to choose.
